channel.title: Portforwwarding problem. [modified]
channel.description: OK so im portforwarding with a verizon router and there are like no guides for doing it i set the ports and so forth but it wants and Port map start. what shouldthat be 43594? but i don't have to put ips in or anything i added the ports and stuff but i stil lcant get it to work :/

item.title: Portforwwarding problem. [modified]
item.dc:creator: @hadesflames hadesflames
item.description:
@hadesflames wrote:

It doesn’t “have” to be 43594…it can be any port as long as no other application uses it, and your server is set to listen on that port, and your client is set to connect using that port. 43594 just happens to be the default everyone uses.

Anyway, try this website to find your specific router for a specific set of instructions:

http://portforward.com/

Read full topic

item.title: Portforwwarding problem. [modified]
item.dc:creator: @Demon6994 Demon6994
item.description:
@Demon6994 wrote:

With portforwarding on your roughter, you HAVE to portforward with 43594. And hit also needs to be set to both UDP, and TCP, then that’s all you have to do. The rest you have to do is just ‘run’ the server. I hope that helps, kinda. e.e I’m kinda lame because it’s hard to explain

Read full topic
